result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Keith Andrews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian Keith Andrews is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian Keith Andrews was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Brian Keith Andrews was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Keith Andrews

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 10-24-18; unpaid court obligations of $811 and supervision fees of $70
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel

4:00 P.M., Defendant Brian Keith Andrews in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sentences defendant to: Ct. 2, 5 months jail w/Huber, concurrent to Ct. 3, forthwith, any unpaid court obligations to be converted into a civil judgment, Ct. 3, 5 months jail w/Huber, concurrent to Ct. 2, any unpaid court obligations to be converted into a civil judgment, 113 days sentence credit, 18 CM 238 and 18 CM 334 settled, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 2 in 18 CM 238 and Ct. 1 in 18 CM 334, Court finds defendant guilty, Judgment to be entered, 18 CM 238, Ct. 1 and 18 CM 334, Ct. 2 and Ct. 3 dismissed, read in, Court sentences defendant to: 18 CM 238, Ct. 2, 30 days jail w/Huber, consecutive, $443.00 costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, defendant to submit DNA Sample, 23 days sentence credit, 18 CM 334, Ct. 1, 4 month jail w/Huber, consecutive, $543.00 costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, defendant to submit DNA Sample, 43 days sentence credit, 4:30 P.M.
Appointed Attorney Ronald Benavides
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 24, 2018 at 04:00 pm.

cc: public defender

1:06 P.M., Defendant, Brian Keith Andrews, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses defendant's non-payment on financial obligations, Defendant states only payments have been made through tax intercept, Defendant requesting 60 days to make payment, Court will extend probation for 6 months or until all financial obligations are paid in full, 1:11 P.M.
Probation review hearing on April 17, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Copy of JOC mailed to defendant at Columbia County Jail, returned no longer there.
Filed by Attorney Tristan Eagon
Filed by Attorney Tristan Eagon

Defendant Brian Keith Andrews in court, in custody with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called: 13CM553, 14CM353, and 16CF56.  Sentencing is agreed upon for 16CF56.  In 16CF56 Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Cts. 2 & 3.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered. Ct. 1 Dismissed.  Sentencing recommendations argued by State and Defense for 13CM553 and 14CM353.  Court sentenced defendant in 13CM553 to serve 90 days in jail, with Huber for work and treatment.  78 days credit.  In 14CM353 Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 months in jail, consecutive to 13CM553, with Huber for work and treatment.  180 days jail credit. In 16CF56 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years, consecutive to 13CM553 and 14CM353.  Conditions of probation include:  AODA and comply, submit DNA sample.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Psychological evaluation and comply with treatment.  Ct. 2 $543.00 costs.  Ct. 3 $343.00 costs.  90 days of conditional jail time, stayed to commence immediately upon any violation of probation. 35 days credit.  1:28/2:13
for Atty Eagon
For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by  DA Jane Kohlwey
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by  DA Jane Kohlwey
Copy of Letter from DA Jane Kohlwey to Atty Tristan Eagon    re:  Discovery.
Attorney Appointed Tristan Eagon
with Petition for Leave to file Additional Motions filed by Atty.Tristan Eagon

Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with KKA, ALA, BKA, SRA, or thier residences, work places, or schools.  May return 1x with law enforcement to get personal belongings.  Must provide new address before being released from jail.

Defendant Brian Keith Andrews by video, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $5,000.00 signature bond.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with KKA, ALA, BKA, SRA, their residences, work place, or schools.  May return 1x with law to get personal belongings.  Standard felony conditions.  New address will need to be given by defendant before he is released from jail.  Time limits waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 09:10 am.  Return date scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
